ai-mn152:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kajaṅgalā in a bamboo grove.
ai-mn152:2.1_0: Then the brahmin student Uttara, a pupil of the brahmin Pārāsariya, approached the Buddha.
ai-mn152:2.2_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-mn152:2.3_0: “Uttara, does Pārāsariya teach his disciples the development of the faculties?”
ai-mn152:2.5_0: “But how does Pārāsariya teach his disciples the development of the faculties?”
ai-mn152:2.6_0: “Master Gotama, it’s when the eye sees no sight and the ear hears no sound.
ai-mn152:2.7_0: That’s how Pārāsariya teaches his disciples the development of the faculties.”
ai-mn152:2.8_0: “In that case, Uttara, a blind person and a deaf person will have developed faculties
ai-mn152:2.10_0: Because a blind man sees a sight with his eyes. They don’t hear a sound with the ear.”
ai-mn152:2.11_0: When he said this, Uttara sat silent, embarrassed, shoulders drooping, downcast, depressed, with nothing to say.
ai-mn152:3.1_0: Knowing this, the Buddha addressed Venerable Ānanda,
ai-mn152:3.2_0: “Ānanda, the development of the faculties taught by Pārāsariya is quite different from the supreme development of the faculties in the training of the Noble One.”
ai-mn152:3.3_0: “Now is the time, Blessed One! Now is the time, Holy One.
ai-mn152:3.4_0: Let the Buddha teach the supreme development of the faculties in the training of the Noble One.
ai-mn152:3.4_1: The mendicants will listen and remember it.”
ai-mn152:3.5_0: “Well then, Ānanda, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-mn152:4.1_0: “And how, Ānanda, is there the supreme development of the faculties in the training of the Noble One?
ai-mn152:4.2_0: When a mendicant sees a sight with their eyes, liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking come up in them.
ai-mn152:4.4_0: ‘Liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking have come up in me.
ai-mn152:4.5_0: That’s conditioned, coarse, and dependently originated.
ai-mn152:4.6_0: But this is peaceful and sublime, namely
ai-mn152:4.8_0: Then the liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking that came up in them cease,
ai-mn152:4.10_0: It’s like how a person with good sight might open their eyes then shut them; or might shut their eyes then open them.
ai-mn152:4.11_0: Such is the speed, the swiftness, the ease with which any liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking at all that came up in them cease, and equanimity becomes stabilized.
ai-mn152:4.12_0: In the training of the Noble One this is called the supreme development of the faculties regarding sights known by the eye.
ai-mn152:5.1_0: Furthermore, when a mendicant hears a sound with their ears, liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking come up in them.
ai-mn152:5.3_0: ‘Liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking have come up in me.
ai-mn152:5.4_0: That’s conditioned, coarse, and dependently originated.
ai-mn152:5.5_0: But this is peaceful and sublime, namely
ai-mn152:5.7_0: Then the liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking that came up in them cease,
ai-mn152:5.9_0: It’s like how a strong person can effortlessly snap their fingers.
ai-mn152:5.10_0: Such is the speed, the swiftness, the ease with which any liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking at all that came up in them cease, and equanimity becomes stabilized.
ai-mn152:5.11_0: In the training of the Noble One this is called the supreme development of the faculties regarding sounds known by the ear.
ai-mn152:6.1_0: Furthermore, when a mendicant smells an odor with their nose, liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking come up in them.
ai-mn152:6.3_0: ‘Liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking have come up in me.
ai-mn152:6.4_0: That’s conditioned, coarse, and dependently originated.
ai-mn152:6.5_0: But this is peaceful and sublime, namely
ai-mn152:6.7_0: Then the liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking that came up in them cease,
ai-mn152:6.9_0: It’s like how a drop of water would roll off a gently sloping lotus leaf, and would not stay there.
ai-mn152:6.10_0: Such is the speed, the swiftness, the ease with which any liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking at all that came up in them cease, and equanimity becomes stabilized.
ai-mn152:6.11_0: In the training of the Noble One this is called the supreme development of the faculties regarding smells known by the nose.
ai-mn152:7.1_0: Furthermore, when a mendicant tastes a flavor with their tongue, liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking come up in them.
ai-mn152:7.3_0: ‘Liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking have come up in me.
ai-mn152:7.4_0: That’s conditioned, coarse, and dependently originated.
ai-mn152:7.5_0: But this is peaceful and sublime, namely
ai-mn152:7.7_0: Then the liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking that came up in them cease,
ai-mn152:7.9_0: It’s like how a strong person who’s formed a glob of spit on the tip of their tongue could easily spit it out.
ai-mn152:7.10_0: Such is the speed, the swiftness, the ease with which any liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking at all that came up in them cease, and equanimity becomes stabilized.
ai-mn152:7.11_0: In the training of the Noble One this is called the supreme development of the faculties regarding tastes known by the tongue.
ai-mn152:8.1_0: Furthermore, when a mendicant feels a touch with their body, liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking come up in them.
ai-mn152:8.3_0: ‘Liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking have come up in me.
ai-mn152:8.4_0: That’s conditioned, coarse, and dependently originated.
ai-mn152:8.5_0: But this is peaceful and sublime, namely
ai-mn152:8.7_0: Then the liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking that came up in them cease,
ai-mn152:8.9_0: It’s like how a strong person can extend or contract their arm.
ai-mn152:8.10_0: Such is the speed, the swiftness, the ease with which any liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking at all that came up in them cease, and equanimity becomes stabilized.
ai-mn152:8.11_0: In the training of the Noble One this is called the supreme development of the faculties regarding touches known by the body.
ai-mn152:9.1_0: Furthermore, when a mendicant knows a thought with their mind, liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking come up in them.
ai-mn152:9.3_0: ‘Liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking have come up in me.
ai-mn152:9.4_0: That’s conditioned, coarse, and dependently originated.
ai-mn152:9.5_0: But this is peaceful and sublime, namely
ai-mn152:9.7_0: Then the liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking that came up in them cease,
ai-mn152:9.9_0: It’s like how a strong person could let two or three drops of water fall onto an iron cauldron that had been heated all day.
ai-mn152:9.10_0: The drops would be slow to fall, but they’d quickly dry up and evaporate.
ai-mn152:9.11_0: Such is the speed, the swiftness, the ease with which any liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking at all that came up in them cease, and equanimity becomes stabilized.
ai-mn152:9.12_0: In the training of the Noble One this is called the supreme development of the faculties regarding thoughts known by the mind.
ai-mn152:9.13_0: That’s how there is the supreme development of the faculties in the training of the Noble One.
ai-mn152:10.1_0: And how are they a practicing trainee?
ai-mn152:10.2_0: When a mendicant sees a sight with their eyes, liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking come up in them.
ai-mn152:10.3_0: They are horrified, repelled, and disgusted by that.
ai-mn152:10.4_0: When you hear a sound with your ears ...
ai-mn152:10.5_0: When they smell an odor with their nose ...
ai-mn152:10.6_0: Tasting a flavor with the tongue ...
ai-mn152:10.7_0: Feeling a touch with the body ...
ai-mn152:10.8_0: When they know a thought with their mind, liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking come up in them.
ai-mn152:10.9_0: They are horrified, repelled, and disgusted by that.
ai-mn152:10.10_0: That’s how there is a practicing trainee.
ai-mn152:11-15.1_0: And how are they a noble one with developed faculties?
ai-mn152:11-15.2_0: When a mendicant sees a sight with their eyes, liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking come up in them.
ai-mn152:11-15.3_0: If they wish: ‘May I meditate perceiving the unrepulsive in the repulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-mn152:11-15.4_0: If they wish: ‘May I meditate perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-mn152:11-15.5_1: ‘May I meditate perceiving the unrepulsive in the repulsive and the unrepulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-mn152:11-15.6_1: ‘May I meditate perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive and the repulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-mn152:11-15.7_1: ‘May I meditate staying equanimous, mindful and aware, rejecting both the repulsive and the unrepulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-mn152:16.1_0: When they hear a sound with their ear ...
ai-mn152:16.2_0: When they smell an odor with their nose ...
ai-mn152:16.3_0: Tasting a flavor with the tongue ...
ai-mn152:16.4_0: Feeling a touch with the body ...
ai-mn152:16.5_0: When they know a thought with their mind, liking, disliking, and both liking and disliking come up in them.
ai-mn152:16.6_0: If they wish: ‘May I meditate perceiving the unrepulsive in the repulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-mn152:16.7_0: If they wish: ‘May I meditate perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-mn152:16.8_1: ‘May I meditate perceiving the unrepulsive in the repulsive and the unrepulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-mn152:16.9_1: ‘May I meditate perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive and the repulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-mn152:16.10_1: ‘May I meditate staying equanimous, mindful and aware, rejecting both the repulsive and the unrepulsive,’ that’s what they do.
ai-mn152:16.11_0: That’s how they are a noble one with developed faculties.
ai-mn152:17.1_0: So, Ānanda, I have taught the supreme development of the faculties in the training of the Noble One, I have taught the practicing trainee, and I have taught the noble one with developed faculties.
ai-mn152:18.1_0: Out of compassion, I’ve done what a teacher should do who wants what’s best for their disciples.
ai-mn152:18.2_0: Here are these roots of trees, and here are these empty huts.
ai-mn152:18.2_1: This is my instruction to you.”
ai-mn152:18.3_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-mn152:18.4_0: Satisfied, Venerable Ānanda was happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-mn152:18.5_0: The tenth section on the faculties is finished.
ai-mn152:18.6_0: The fifth sub-chapter on the six sense fields is finished.
ai-mn152:19.5_0: and also the development of the faculties.
ai-mn152:20.0_0: This is the fire of the Vaggumudā.
ai-mn152:20.3_0: the six sense fields are incomplete.
ai-mn152:20.4_0: if she stands at the gateway;
ai-mn152:20.5_0: The chapter on offenses is finished.
